verses.roman:
rātri-divase lokera śuni' kolāhala
vārāṇasī chāḍi' prabhu āilā nīlācala

synonyms: rātri—night; divase—day; lokera—of the people in general; śuni—hearing; kolāhala—tumult; vārāṇasī—the city of Benares; chāḍi'-leaving; prabhu—the Lord; āilā—returned; nīlācala—to Purī.
translation: Because the city of Vārāṇasī was always full of tumultuous crowds, Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, after sending Sanātana to Vṛndāvana, returned to Jagannātha Purī.
